problem_prompt:
Solve the following problem. Suppose $77\cdot 88\cdot 99 \equiv n\pmod{20}$, where $0\le n<20$.

What is the value of $n$?
gpt_response:
We can simplify the problem by considering the remainders of each number when divided by 20.

$77\equiv 17 \pmod{20}$
$88\equiv 8 \pmod{20}$
$99\equiv 19 \pmod{20}$

Thus, $77\cdot 88\cdot 99 \equiv 17\cdot 8\cdot 19 \equiv 2588 \equiv 8 \pmod{20}$

Therefore, the value of $n$ is $\boxed{8}$.
solution_prompt:
